newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-North still spending on Lake Cowal.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-North still spending on Lake Cowal.

text.p: Mining and forestry group North Ltd said on Wednesday it would spend a further A$1 million on exploration until at least December at its troubled Lake Cowal gold project in New South Wales.
North said it was committed to developing the project, which was rejected last April by the New South Wales Minister for Urban Affairs and Planning.
The rejection followed development approval for the A$180 million mine by a government-appointed commission of inquiry.
The company said it was continuing to seek discussions with the government to find a way to get the project moving.
A North spokesman said the company had spent about A$26.5 million on the project so far and did not wish to see that expenditure written off.
North has forecast the mine would produce 232,000 ounces of gold per year over the first seven years and 100,000 ounces per year in the remaining four years.
